summary: Internal DOJ email regarding Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) litigation related to the Epstein case. A DOJ spokesperson discusses a press inquiry about referring media questions to the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and asks about the timing of a voluminous document release expected to take the New York Times significant time to process.

persons.name: Spokesman United States Department of Justice
persons.context: Author of the email discussing FOIA litigation and press inquiries regarding the Epstein case.

events.title: FOIA Litigation Press Inquiry
events.description: A DOJ spokesperson receives a call from a press counterpart regarding FOIA litigation related to the Epstein case, discussing referral of press inquiries to SDNY and anticipating a voluminous document release.
personsInvolved: Spokesman United States Department of Justice

keyFacts: The email discusses FOIA litigation related to the Epstein case.
A press inquiry was made about referring media questions to the Southern District of New York (SDNY).
A voluminous document release was anticipated, expected to take the New York Times significant time to process.
The DOJ spokesperson anticipated declining to comment on the matter.
